update.description: URDF specifies the pose of a link relative to its parent in the `<origin>` tag of the joint that connects the two links. And the child link's frame is coincident with its parent joint frame. This style of specifying kinematics can be replicated in SDFormat by making use of frame semantics. Doing so is beneficial because it limits precision loss and keeps the structure of the SDF file similar to the source URDF file.
update.title: Keep the URDF style of specifying kinematics when converting URDF to SDF by using frame semantics.

content.raw:
I think you might be right about the  `(parent link, joint, child link)` order. Looking closer at the examples, it seems like the order `(parent link, child link, joint)` is mostly used only when the parent link is the base (first) link. 

Okay, I'll take a quick look at changing the order. If it takes too long, I'll merge this and come back to it later.
content.html:
I think you might be right about the (parent link, joint, child link) order. Looking closer at the examples, it seems like the order (parent link, child link, joint) is mostly used only when the parent link is the base (first) link.

Okay, I'll take a quick look at changing the order. If it takes too long, I'll merge this and come back to it later.

content.raw:
Can you specify which examples?

I am looking at the following page: [http://wiki.ros.org/urdf/Examples](http://wiki.ros.org/urdf/Examples)

And following \(some of\) those links, I see the ordering of \(parent link, joint, child link\):  
[https://github.com/mikeferguson/maxwell/blob/melodic-devel/maxwell\_defs/urdf/maxwell.urdf](https://github.com/mikeferguson/maxwell/blob/melodic-devel/maxwell_defs/urdf/maxwell.urdf)  
[https://github.com/uos/katana\_driver/blob/kinetic/katana\_description/urdf/katana\_300\_6m180.urdf.xacro](https://github.com/uos/katana_driver/blob/kinetic/katana_description/urdf/katana_300_6m180.urdf.xacro)

content.raw: Since this is the expected output string, changing the order here would require changing the URDF to SDF converter code, which I'd rather avoid. Also, most examples of URDF I've seen have joints come after links. It seems like the converter is following convention?
content.html: Since this is the expected output string, changing the order here would require changing the URDF to SDF converter code, which I'd rather avoid. Also, most examples of URDF I've seen have joints come after links. It seems like the converter is following convention?

content.raw: I grafted your commit in 671266a and renamed `parentLinkName` to `relativeToAttr` in 68f25af to prevent someone else using it in place of `_link->getParent()->name`. I also added a `world` link in the `CheckJointTransform` test in 0210bc6.
content.html: I grafted your commit in 671266a and renamed parentLinkName to relativeToAttr in 68f25af to prevent someone else using it in place of _link->getParent()->name. I also added a world link in the CheckJointTransform test in 0210bc6.

pullrequest.title: Keep the URDF style of specifying kinematics when converting URDF to SDF by using frame semantics.

content.raw:
adding this test exposed an issue with this pull request related to the common use of links named `world` in urdf files. For example, the [provide_feedback.urdf](#!/osrf/sdformat/src/6b5eeac2a27ddb3408c0a8338fdb1230d9d1ff5b/test/integration/provide_feedback.urdf#lines-4:27) file used in the test in pr #680 has an empty `<link name='world' />` that is used as the parent link for a joint. I believe this is a common practice, as it is included in [training material provided by ROS Industrial](https://industrial-training-master.readthedocs.io/en/melodic/_source/session3/Intro-to-URDF.html) and several of the example urdf files in this repository. The test in pr #680 passes when merged with sdf9, but has loading errors in this branch (see failed pipeline for commit 7512866):

~~~
[ RUN      ] DOMJoint.LoadURDFJointPoseRelativeTo
Error Code 24 Msg: relative_to name[world] specified by joint with name[jointw0] does not match a link, joint, or frame name in model with name[provide_feedback_test].
...
~~~

I think we could consider adding a special case that would convert `"world'` to `"__model__"` before setting `//joint/pose/@relative_to`
content.html:
adding this test exposed an issue with this pull request related to the common use of links named world in urdf files. For example, the provide_feedback.urdf file used in the test in pr #680 has an empty <link name='world' /> that is used as the parent link for a joint. I believe this is a common practice, as it is included in training material provided by ROS Industrial and several of the example urdf files in this repository. The test in pr #680 passes when merged with sdf9, but has loading errors in this branch (see failed pipeline for commit 7512866):

[ RUN      ] DOMJoint.LoadURDFJointPoseRelativeTo
Error Code 24 Msg: relative_to name[world] specified by joint with name[jointw0] does not match a link, joint, or frame name in model with name[provide_feedback_test].
...

I think we could consider adding a special case that would convert "world' to "__model__" before setting //joint/pose/@relative_to

content.raw: I'm not sure any of our frame semantics tests read from a URDF input file. Before merging this change, I'd like to add such a test to sdf9, and then confirm that it still passes with this PR. I think that will help identify any regressions / behavior changes.
content.html: I'm not sure any of our frame semantics tests read from a URDF input file. Before merging this change, I'd like to add such a test to sdf9, and then confirm that it still passes with this PR. I think that will help identify any regressions / behavior changes.
